advancementRoot.description: A world of creatures big and small.
advancements.adventure.throw_trident.des:
Throw a throwable weapon at something.
Note: Throwing away your only weapon is not a good idea.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.black_fore:
These wooden creatures seem to arise from the bark of the surrounding trees. Their method of reproduction eludes me if they have one at all.

They do not eat nor sleep but retreat into the trees. If bribed with rich minerals, they may assist you in obtaining saplings to further their home turf.
Dark Oak Forests and Fir Forests during Thunderstorms
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.boar.descr:
Boars seem to be incredibly closely related to the pink pigs scattered throughout the world. Not close enough to interbreed.

Despite this, their behavior is mostly identical. However, Boars can and will be aggressive to any attackers.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.brimstone_:
A mighty construct hailing from the Nether, these golems pack a far bigger punch than anything manufactured in the Overworld to date.

Be very careful around them, they’re unpredictable and highly aggressive. Even from a range, they deftly take out their prey.
Brimstone Caverns, Bastion Remnants, and Constructable
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup1.descr:
These gargantuan jelly-like creatures are monsters of death and destruction. They barely seem to register any hit I do.

I managed to fell one, once. And it simply split into two, and continued with its onslaught. Be wary around these monsters.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup1.spawn: New Moons, and Swamps at daytime
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup2.descr:
Just like their brethren, the Geeps will not hesitate to destroy you. Their gelatinous spikes will puncture any armor you have, trust me.

They don’t care about the safety of anything nearby, they attack indiscriminatorily, and do it full of rage and malic and vitriol.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup2.spawn: New Moons, and Swamps at daytime
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup3.descr:
I know they look friendly.
Do. Not. Approach. One of these things almost killed me, and it did so with the same adorably vacant face.

During certain storms, I’ve actually seen them swell in size. I must look into that more in the future, for my own safety.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.gup3.spawn: New Moons, Swamps at daytime, and with the Jockey
I thought they weren’t real, but I’m sitting here right now, writing this next to a real Jackalope. It’s much smaller than I thought.

Jackalopes have mighty horns! On the sad day that this beast passes, I will be making use of them. I have some ideas for a weaponized headdress…
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.jockey.des:
The Jockey is an elusive guy. He just shows up outside my house every so often and trades me some exotic brews.

He tells me of outlandish things, creatures and worlds I’ve never seen before. I barely believe him. But his impressive mounts certainly lend him credibility.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.sabertooth:
This ferocious feline is from times long gone, kept cultivated and domesticated by its savior from extinction.

A powerful attacker, using claws and teeth. The teeth themselves can be fashioned into a deadly weapon, or so I’ve heard. I hope I can witness that one day.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.shulkren_y:
One of the few friendly faces in the abyssal dimension of The End. The Shulkren Younglings are childish and curious.

They are willing to trade with me, and in turn, I protect them from the harsh wilds. They love to garden, it’s a rather cute change of pace in this world.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.tbh.descri:
I… don’t know what to say about this one. I observe them from a distance, watching them frolick throughout the flowers. They don’t do anything else.

I ventured too close, once. Looked it right in those vacant eyes. This thing has knowledge no creature should have.
bestiary.featuresandcreatures.tbh.spawn: Flower Forest, Meadows, Plains, and Sunflower Plains at daytime.
